actions.text: Referred to House Committee on The Judiciary.
Referred to Subcommittee on Administrative Law and Governmental Relations.
Executive Comment Requested from CIA, DOD, HHS, Justice, NASA, VA.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Administrative Law and Governmental Relations

official_title: A bill to amend chapter 171 of title 28, United States Code, to alter procedures with respect to certain malpractice suits against Federal medical personnel, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Makes the Federal tort claims procedures the exclusive remedy in medical malpractice actions involving a Federal employee engaged in health care for a negligent or wrongful act or omission occurring within the scope of employment. Grants under certain circumstances a 30-day grace period for filing an administrative claim to a plaintiff whose suit arising out of medical malpractice or negligent operation of a motor vehicle by a Federal employee is removed from State to Federal court. Repeals, with respect to health care functions, the prohibitions against Government liability for certain intentional torts.

titles.title: A bill to amend chapter 171 of title 28, United States Code, to alter procedures with respect to certain malpractice suits against Federal medical personnel, and for other purposes.
